title: Holt Barkl and Landers on resistance - context

content.question: Which of the following best describes a historical context that connected the Africans discussed in Source 1 with the Spanish discussed in Source 2?

choices.label: Spanish Florida was predominantly Catholic and many of the participants in the Stono Rebellion were from a largely Catholic region of Africa.
The griot tradition originated in Spain and spread to the region of Africa where many of the participants in the Stono rebellion originated.
Many enslaved people from the region near the Stono River were forced to relocate to Spanish Florida during the Second Middle Passage.
The American Colonization Society exiled free Black people from South Carolina to Spanish Florida for many years.

content.answer: Spanish Florida was predominantly Catholic and many of the participants in the Stono Rebellion were from a largely Catholic region of Africa.
